awd_titl_txt: Workshop: Taking Data Science to America's Emerging Workforce
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering

por.por_cntn:
The National Science Foundation and the Sloan Foundation funded a workshop held at NC State to explore leveraging Land Grant Universities and the Ag/Cooperative Extension structure to bring Data Science capability to rural areas in order to grow economic prosperity. The focus of the “Taking Data Science to America’s Emerging Workforce” Workshop was to explore the interests, issues, and feasibility of leveraging the significant expertise, resources and infrastructure of the land-grant universities to help address the educational, community, research, and workforce needs of the nation in data science over the next two decades. Specifically, staff members from NC State University, Iowa State University, Oregon State University, Virginia Tech, and RTI International acted as the Workshop Program Committee and helped assemble the agenda, invitation list, workshop report, and the final set of recommendations.  The final report contains a roadmap for Cooperative Extension programs to leverage extension agents in order to bring the skills of data science to rural communities.

 

The workshop also received funding from the Sloan Foundation which funded three pilot projects at NC State, Iowa State and Oregon State to implement some of the Roadmap strategies.  All three reports are including in the final report.  The pilots showed the feasibility and interest of extension agents and rural groups to learn and implement data science tools.

 


Last Modified: 06/20/2019
Modified by: Marc I Hoit
